plugins.name: Figma Color Variables Import / Export
plugins.description:
Register the Color Token created with Token Studio etc. in Figma's Variables.


Usage

‚óèImport from JSON to Variables

1. Export Color Token to JSON by Token Studio or other tools

2. Import Color Token to JSON by this plugin


‚óèExport Variables to JSON

Click „ÄåExport With Alias„Äç or„ÄåExport With RawValue„Äç

(This JSON file can be read by Token Studio)


Function

  • ‚úÖ Solid (Fill 100%)
  • ‚úÖ Solid (Fill not 100%)
  • üôÖ Gradient
  • üôÖ String
  • üôÖ Number



Sample Token

{
  "color": { // immediate object key to Collection name
    "primitive": {
      "white": {
        "value": "#FFFFFF",
        "type": "color"
      }
    },
    "semantic": {
      "background": {
        "light": {
          "value": "{color.primitive.white}",
          "description": "light background",
          "type": "color"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
plugins.tagline: A minimal plugin to transfer JSON to Figma variables.

plugins.name: Layer Styles
plugins.description:
Save and apply style presets, including strokes, fills, corner radius, effects, padding, layout grids, layer opacity and blend modes.


Create a layer style


  1. Run Plugins > Layer Styles > Show Layer Styles
  2. Select a frame or shape with styles already applied
  3. Click the + in the bottom right of the plugin window


Apply a layer style


  1. Select the layers you would like to apply the layer style to
  2. Click on the layer style in the list to apply that style


Refresh layer styles


After you make a change to a layer style, you can update any layers which were previously applied with this layer style.


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Right-click on the layer style
  3. Click Refresh


Detaching layer styles from layers


If you no longer want a layer to be associated with a layer style you can detach it.


  1. Select the layer you want to detach the layer style from
  2. In the Properties Panel under Plugin, click "Detach Layer Style".


NOTE: Be careful not to click the minus button as this will remove the plugin command instead. If this happens by mistake, you can re-apply the style and the option to detach the layer style will appear again.


Known issues


  1. There is a bug when creating styles than use variables for the corner radius where the variable is detached

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Save and apply style combinations, such as fills, corner radius, and more

plugins.name: Arabs - Names, Phone, and Addresses
plugins.description:
"Arabs" is a Figma plugin that replaces plain text with fictitious, but accurate, Arabic user data, including names, phone numbers, and addresses. All this info may be customized to fit the interface layout and the type of data displayed. The plugin supports both English and Arabic texts.


The plugin can generate the following characteristics:

  • Country (Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates)
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Addresses


With the following attributes customization:

‚Üí Names

  • Male or female
  • Dual (First and last) or Triple (First, middle, and last)

‚Üí Phone numbers

  • Country codes

‚Üí Addresses

  • City
  • Neighborhood
  • Street
  • Landmark


How to use the plugin:

Just select any text in Figma and run the plugin. Choose the country from which you want to add user info, select the characteristic you want to insert, customize the attributes and press the Replace button.


You can use the plugin in the following cases, and more:

  • Replace sterile "user name" and "user address" with genuine data.
  • Create personas for your user experience research.
  • Add names, addresses, or numbers in control panels or dashboards‚Äô tables and lists.
  • Addresses can be produced with one or more details such as city, street, and landmark.
  • Fill in user profile details with life-like data.
  • Empower Arabic interface design content.
plugins.tagline: Replace text with fictitious, but accurate, Arabic user data; names, phone numbers, and addresses.

plugins.name: imgcook
plugins.description:
English | ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá


imgcook for Figma


A intelligent tool that converts design to code.


imgcook is an ingenious chef who specializes in cooking with various images (Sketch / PSD / static images). it will intelligently generate front-end codes, including view codes, data-binding codes, component codes as well as part of business logic codes from different kinds of design documents.


Our Website: https://www.imgcook.com



How to use the imgcook plugin?


1. Make sure you are logged into your imgcook account.

2. In Figma, go to Plugins and pick imgcook. You should see a new export window.

3. Select any number of frames and hit Export. imgcook will open the "Export successfully, copied to clipboard!" prompt pop-up layer, and then click Go to Paste to restore.


Other functions

  • merge: Merge all the layers in the folder into one picture.
  • group: Circle some layers under a dom node.


4. imgcook will open the editor in a new browser tab. Paste and restore in the editor ctr+v and save as a module, and that‚Äôs it.



Community support


For general help using imgcook, please refer to the documentation. For additional help, you can use one of these channels to ask a question:


- GitHub (Bug reports)

- Medium (Get blogs and articles)

- Áü•‰πé‰∏ìÊ†è (Get blogs and articles in Simplified Chinese)

plugins.name: Color Theme Manager
plugins.description:
About

Color Theme Manager is a light weight easy to use plugin for create and swap between different color themes. Simply save color styles as you normally do and Color Theme Manager can help you with the rest. No need to worry about JSON, naming prefix, selection, etc. Good for developing color systems, projects require multiple color themes (like dark mode and light mode), and giving your design a new look.

Features

Save Color Theme
Carefully name your current color theme and it will be saved within the Figma file you are working with. This will save all local color styles into a color theme. Note color styles in color themes will not update when you modified local color styles, you need to manually save changes to color themes.

Apply Color Theme
Change to an entirely different look by applying a color theme with only one click. Your local color styles will be replaced by ones from the color theme you choose.

 Import/Export Color Themes
Due to the current Figma Plugin API limitation, transferring data across Figma file can not be streamlined. A second-best solution is offered by Color Theme Manager, simply copy your saved color theme into clipboard and paste to another file.

How?

Color Theme Manager will look for color style from a saved theme with the exact same name and replace the local style. So name your color styles (and color themes) wisely. Repeated names will cause unexpected results.

Future

- Features like auto update, read/write to libraries can not be implemented efficiently with the current set of APIs. This might change when new APIs come out.
- Color styles involve image fill is not implemented very efficiently. This might be fixed in a future update.
- UI might be reimplemented in a more maintainable way.

plugins.name: SF Symbols Optimizer
plugins.description:
This plugin exports icons created in Figma in SVG format and adds them to custom symbols in SF Symbols It is compatible with SF Symbols 5 and SF Symbols 6.


  1. Open a page in Figma with icons you want to make into SF Symbols; icons created as Frames or Components will be exported.
  2. Select multiple Frames or Components to be exported and click the "Scan" button in the plug-in window. If no frames or components are selected, all frames and components in the page will be registered for export.
  3. Click the "Export" icon to export the SVG file in the SF Symbols 5 format. This SVG files will contain only the following variations size=Small, weight=UltraLight, Regular, Black
  4. Add this SVG file to Xcode as an asset and use it as a custom symbol. Through the SF Symbols mechanism, symbols are available for all Weights and Scales.


* Icons should be sized 1:1 aspect ratio, with no fill color applied to the background.

TSUMIKI INC.

plugins.tagline: Optimize Icon to SVG file for import into SF Symbols 6 and SF Symbols 5.

plugins.name: Crowdin for Figma
plugins.description:
Localize UI and translate marketing visuals efficiently with Crowdin plugin for Figma.


Crowdin is a cloud-based localization management platform that speeds up and automates localization. Trusted by GitHub, Pipedrive, GitLab, Buffer, and Magento, it helps companies of any size localize their apps, websites, games, marketing content, and more.


Use Cases


Crowdin plugin for Figma will be of use if you:

 

  1. Create multilingual user interfaces and want to provide clear experiences across markets. Learn more.
  2. Collaborate with other teams on mobile applications or software localization.
  3. Need to quickly translate static visuals like social media graphics, posters, blog visuals, and more. Learn more.


Synchronize Localizable Content Across Tools

 

Crowdin integration with Figma works both ways. You can send designs for translation and upload them back to Figma for further customization. 

 

When localizing UI, you can synchronize content between Figma, Crowdin, and your repository on GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and Azure Repos. Your engineering team can use Crowdin API and CLI to set up instant content synchronization.


Prototype with the Real Copy and Test Translated Versions


Once the production-ready texts are uploaded to Crowdin, you can stop using Lorem Ipsum in your mockups. 


Get the list of source strings, use the real copy in your mockups, edit texts if necessary, and send new strings for translation with the keys and screenshots for translators. 


Upload translated mockups back to Figma and customize them before the development starts.


Learn more.


Set up Continuous Workflow for App Localization


App localization can now start at the prototyping step:


  1. Designers send texts for translation to Crowdin with the keys, tags, and screenshots.
  2. Translation teams work on the texts in Crowdin.
  3. The translated variants are tested and customized back in Figma.
  4. Development teams then download source and translate files from Crowdin and integrate them into the codebase.
  5. Works in Figma Dev mode, allowing developers to quickly inspect the text layer and get all information about the string, including its file or key.


Use Different Translation Approaches


In Crowdin, texts can be pre-translated via AI or Machine Translation engines (Google Translator, DeepL, Microsoft Translator, and others). You can also invite your in-house translators, freelancers, or an agency. Crowdin will create Translation Memory automatically, so you will be able to reuse translations and pre-translate texts using your TM in the future.


Human translators will have sufficient context while translating your content. When working on UI localization, you can automatically upload screenshots to the localization project.


When translating static pages, like posters and banners, translators will preview full frames in Crowdin and see the visual context for every text.


How to Set Up


To get started, you will need a Crowdin account and a localization project under it. You can create a new project, or ask for manager access to the existing one.

Sign up for a Crowdin account.


If you manage a project in Crowdin yourself after a 14-day free trial, select one of the subscription plans.


To connect Figma and Crowdin accounts:


1. Install Crowdin for Figma Plugin.

2. Open the necessary Figma file.

3. Head to the menu in the top-left corner and select Plugins > Crowdin.

4. Provide Personal Access Token. You can generate it in your Account Settings in Crowdin.

5. If you‚Äôre connecting your Crowdin Enterprise account, specify your Organization name.


See a detailed guide on how to use the Crowdin translation plugin for Figma.


Contact us 24/7 if you need any assistance.

accepted.name: Crowdin
accepted.description: Crowdin is a cloud-based solution that streamlines the localization of the product's user interface, website, marketing, and support content.

plugins.name: Team Library Component Browser
plugins.description:
List, browse, and create instance your team library (and local) components.


üî• What you can:


- List and browse your team library components.

- Create instance of conponent from this plugin.

- Swap the instance and selection(s).

- Keep the size and layout of selection when you swap.


üëâ How to use Team Library Component Browser:


1. Open this plugin in library what you want to list.

2. Go to Setting tab in this plugin.

3. Click ‚ÄòSave or update this library data‚Äô button to save all components data in library to this plugin.

4. Go back to your document and open this plugin.

5. Find components by searching or scrolling, then double-click or click "Create" button to insert instance into document.

6. Enjoyüèñ


üñå Notes:


Because of the specifications of Figma's API, we can't get team library data automatically.

So this plugin uses the figma.clientStorage API to store the library data on your machine.

plugins.name: Shader
plugins.description:
Generate shades and tints of any color in 2 easy steps.


Create up to 255 shades of your selected base color/s. That's right. Create shades of multiple selected colors all in 1 go!


No need to mess with hard to use UI's. Generate shades using just 2 commands.


Required:

  • An element (Shape), with 1 Solid fill.


How to Use:

  1. Select any number of elements with 'Solid' Fill.
  2. Go to Plugins > Shader OR Click Ctrl + / (For Windows) or ‚åÉ + / (For Mac)
  3. Select 'Lighten' or 'Darken' from the dropdown.
  4. Finally, enter the number of shades you want to generate and press Enter


Notes:

It will only generate shades and tints for elements that have a solid fill as their first fill. It will not work for gradients, images or elements with no fill. NO Shades will be created for such elements.


Suggestions to improve the plugin are much appreciated. Enjoy! üòä

accepted.name: Karmit Patel
accepted.description: Frontend Developer.

plugins.name: Vivid | Free React, Tailwind, TS, CSS Modules from Figma
plugins.description:
Vivid cuts out redundant development work by letting designers own your UI while developers focus on functionality.


Designers submit their Figma designs through the Vivid plugin to automatically generate and maintain a UI library in their team‚Äôs codebase. With every new design submitted, Vivid will generate any new components necessary and create a pull request directly in GitHub.


Features

  • Code Generation. Vivid generates React code using TypeScript and CSS modules from your Figma designs.
  • Sandbox Preview. Preview the code Vivid generates in a shareable sandbox.
  • Existing Component Support. Automatically link your implemented components from your codebase to the components available in your Figma asset library.
  • GitHub Integration. Create a pull request for developers to review with the newly generated code.


Roadmap

  • Responsiveness. Vivid will soon allow you to specify different screen sizes for larger designs so that the code you generate will automatically be responsive!
  • Modularity. To prevent unnecessarily long code files, Vivid will automatically break its generated code into more manageable components and files
  • CSS Frameworks. Tailwind and styled components support is coming soon!


Support

Reach out to aryaman@vivid.lol with any feedback, bugs, or support needs!


Join our Slack channel for product updates, to provide feedback, or just to chat!
plugins.tagline: Hand off ready-to-use components from Figma

plugins.name: Advanced Variable Export [AVE]
plugins.description:
This plugin will help you to handle all your variables and styles for the development team!



ü§òKey features:

‚ö° Variables export to code variables

‚ö° Styles (text, effects, colors) export to classes

‚ö° Variables fragmentation to folders depending on the variables hierarchy in the project

‚ö° HEXA or RGBA color export

‚ö° CSS or SCSS color export

‚ö° Complete export of each collection or separate export for single ones

‚ö° Devmode sidebar integration



‚úç More about:

From now on developers can export all basic variables to CSS or even SCSS just in few clicks, bypassing routine of analysing each asset properties or huge variables table.


And even more! If your project has lots of variables with complex hierarchy - it is possible to export variables with fragmentation. If your variables structure looks like different levels and folders - why don't you have your variables stored in real folders - making it simple to maintain them throught the project development? No more obstacles - fragmentation feature is right here as well!


Plugin also allows you to switch between HEX and RGBA formats for colors and export all your text styles into the classess!


üôå Feedback & support

We would appreciate any of your bug reports and functionality suggestions!


You can contact us via email:

üìß info@code-creators.tech

üìß kitponomarenko@gmail.com

plugins.name: WordCloud.app
plugins.description:
Create visual art with this Word Cloud generator plugin!

Add words of your own or use one of our thematic presets. Automatically generate a pleasing color palette. And enjoy your words filling the frame!


How to use

  1. Create a frame.
  2. Pick a preset or add your own words.
  3. Rearrange words as needed. Closer to the beginning = closer to the center.
  4. Add one or several text colors. Colors will be applied to words randomly to create a pleasing picture.
  5. Don't like the arrangement? Click the "refresh" button, it will rearrange words in a new manner.
  6. Select several fonts for a beautiful effect and pick a shape to reflect your theme.
  7. Enjoy!


Have feedback?

Help me understand what features to add next! Report bugs or make suggestions! Please leave feedback here.


Thanks!

‚Äî Elena @ WordCloud.app

plugins.name: Sitemap Gecko
plugins.description:
Spend less time sitemapping and more time creating meaningful designs

Sitemap Gecko is a time-saving sitemapping tool made for busy UX agencies and designers.


Use Cases

Create ready-to-present sitemaps in minutes

Use the sitemap builder to create polished, presentation-ready sitemaps.


Evaluate web structures in seconds

Visualise the site structure of your client (or competitorüòâ) - just enter their website URL.



To get started, try recreating your latest client's site structure using the sitemap builder.



Features

Create visual sitemaps

Use the sitemap builder to create visual sitemaps from scratch.


Visualise site structures from URL

Simply enter a website's URL to visualise its page structure.


Collaborate with your team

Sitemaps/site structures are exported to the Figma canvas where your team can make changes & add comments.


Save sitemaps

Sitemaps made in the builder can be saved & edited later.


Export sitemaps- as images

Once put on the Figma canvas, you can easily export the sitemaps as PNG/JPG/SVG.


Export sitemaps- as XML

Any sitemap created in the builder can also be exported as a XML sitemap. Especially useful if your organisation does SEO.


Get started for free

Sitemap Gecko comes with a free plan, which includes limited usage of the sitemap builder, as well as 2 site structure imports.


Upgrading grants you unlimited sitemap builder usage, sitemap XML exports and 100 sitemap imports. A license costs $23.



Questions & Support

If you have any questions or would like to provide feedback, please contact me at joseph@sitemapgecko.com or leave a comment.

accepted.name: Joseph
accepted.description: Reach out to me on joseph@sitemapgecko.com !

plugins.tagline: Less time sitemapping, more time designing.

plugins.name: Rename layer
plugins.description:
This plugin renames elements (that contains inner elements, like groups, frames, instances..) by a specific inner text layer content.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Demo here.

Support my work here <3


Use case example:

You have cards that represents movies. Each card contains an image, movie name, description and a button. You want to name all the cards by the movie name.



How it works?

  1. Run the plugin
  2. You can choose to rename by
  3. A specific layer name
  4. Another character / phrase that you can add to the beginning of the layer name

Make sure all the frames you want to rename are selected.

Important: This plugin saves the last layer name you replaced by.
plugins.tagline: Bulk renaming based on specific contained text layer

plugins.name: Unit Converter
plugins.description:
The Unit Converter plugin is a powerful tool that simplifies the process of converting measurements from centimeters, millimeters, and meters into pixels. Designed to enhance your workflow, this plugin seamlessly integrates into your favorite Figma software, providing you with instant and accurate pixel conversion results.

With the Unit Converter plugin, you can effortlessly transform your design elements, layouts, or images between different units of measurement. Whether you're working on web design, graphic design, or any project that requires precise pixel-based measurements, this plugin is a valuable asset.
plugins.tagline: Unit Converter from centimeters, millimeters, and meters FREE!

plugins.name: Berrycast: Simple Screen Recorder & Sharing Tool
plugins.description:
Dead simple to use screen recording tool.


Berrycast your colleagues. 

It‚Äôs more productive.


The ability to share what‚Äôs on your screen within Figma and FigJam collaborations with your colleagues has never before been so easy. With Berrycast, simply hit the record button and add your spoken narrative. Your team will be more productive, and your message will be clearer than ever before. 


Get started now > berrycast.com.


Our mission is to make every second of your life more productive. We believe that starts with clear communications supported by the most appropriate tools.


Berrycast is a lightweight extension and native app combo that helps you share messages on your screen, using your voice and your face (both optional) to support your message. By clearly being able to show and articulate your user experience, viewers can learn and understand what you are trying to convey. 


There‚Äôs no longer any need to download an app and then create a video that needs to be uploaded to YouTube. Create and share clear video messages in less time than it would take to type an email. 


It takes 5 easy steps to Berrycast:

  1. Hit record
  2. Strut your stuff (narrate if desired while showing the screen)
  3. Stop the video
  4. Copy the automatically-created URL
  5. Share away! 


How can you use Berrycast to improve productivity? Let us count the ways.


  1. Designs: As you iterate on your app‚Äôs design, recruit your teammates to provide feedback on their own time and at their own convenience. Easily highlight specific elements and narrate the feedback, preventing misunderstandings and confusion, and saving yourself from unnecessary and gruelling review meetings.
  2. Onboarding: Easily record hellos and welcomes to new teammates, communicate goals and progress, saving meeting times for real meetings. Using a new team collaboration tool? Teach your colleagues how to use the product with a quick Berrycast that can be watched at their convenience at varying speeds.
  3. Technical support: Got an issue with something? Record the issue, get the URL, and send it to your tech team to evaluate. This is also perfect for customers to communicate what design concerns they may be observing in your product to improve overall user experience.

plugins.name: Linearity Move - Animation for your Figma designs
plugins.description:
‚ú® Turn Your Figma Designs into Stunning Animations ‚Äì Fast!

Bring your static Figma assets to life with Linearity Move. Whether you‚Äôre working on social media content, brand visuals, or advertising assets, our plugin makes animation effortless. No prior animation experience needed!


üöÄ How It Works:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Download Linearity Move and create a free Linearity account.

plugins.name: Navigator
plugins.description:
An easy way to find and apply color styles from your current document. Navigator will look through all of the layers in your document and find the ones with color styles. Simply select the layer that you want to apply a color styles to, run Navigator, find your color and select it. You can apply a color style to any vector, text, line, frame or group.

Note: If you have a large amount of layers in your document, it might take a few seconds longer to load.

You can use this in conjunction with Chroma or Kaleidocode to create your styles and can keep those frames hidden. Due to limitations with the Figma API, we can only find styles that are on the canvas.

accepted.name: Miguel Solorio
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Find color styles from your file

plugins.name: Auto Layout via keyboard
plugins.description:
Description

I am just too lazy to click on the small button of Auto Layout to change the value, so I made this plugin.


if you find this helpful, feel free to try it out.


How it work?

  1. Choose a frame first
  2. "Search Auto Layout via Keyboard" with quick action bar
  3. Hit "Tab" to enter plugin
  4. Enter the number by the following guide


The parameter have 3 parts:

First part is to choose either you want the layout to be Vertical or Horizontal.


Second is set the spacing between each item, you enter enter any positive number.


Third is set the padding for this auto layout, it's work just like how you set padding in CSS. like 24,48, this mean the top and bottom padding is 24, and left and right padding is 48.


You need to separate the number by comma.


More example

  • Enter 48, this apply to four side of padding.
  • Enter 24,48, 24 apply to top & bottom, 48 apply to left & right.
  • Enter 24,32,48, 24 apply to top, 32 apply to left & right, 48 apply to bottom
  • Enter 24,32,48,12, 24 apply to top, 32 apply to right, 48 apply to bottom, and 12 apply to left (it's clockwise)

plugins.name: Regressor - Auto Instance Creator
plugins.description:
Regressor is a design system component properties testing plugin.


Regressor automatically generates instances for all possible combinations of variant and boolean properties from the corresponding Main Component of the selected instance.


Concept

Regression refers to re-testing an application or system to ensure that new changes or updates do not have any side effects or breaking changes.


Regressor brings regression's ideology from code to design. Regressor is grounded in the principle of regression, which helps you to quickly create all possible test cases for different variant and boolean property combinations before publishing a design component update.


Regressor ensure you publish your design system components without any unexpected side effects or breaking changes after design changes or updates to the components.


Features

  1. Works on both ‚óá Instance and ‚ùñ Component
  2. Create variant and boolean property combinations and render them inside a Auto Layout
  3. Customise Auto Layout Columns, Spacing and Alignment
  4. Create variant and boolean property combinations on current or new page
  5. Preserve or neglect Instance Overrides
  6. Detach or keep Generated Instance associated with main component


Supported Custom Configuration

Regressor can be customised as per design system regression requirement -

  1. Layout Direction (Vertical and Horizontal)
  2. Variant Auto Layout Cell Alignment (Left, Center and Right)
  3. Custom Column or Row Count
  4. Custom Spacing
  5. Create New Page with Custom Name
  6. Preserve Overrides
  7. Detach Generated Instances


Usage Guidelines

To use regressor, follow the steps below ‚Äì

  1. Open the respective Figma file
  2. Select an Instance or Component
  3. Go to Plugin -> Regressor, or search for Regressor using Quick Actions Bar.


Regressor creates a new page with all possible combinations of variant and boolean properties from the corresponding component.


Eliminate the risk of unexpected side effects or breaking changes and publish design system component updates with confidence.


Privacy

Regressor values your privacy and does not collect any data from your Figma files, projects, or teams.


Your data belongs to you. You can trust your data is safe, and Regressor can not exploit data related to your Figma files, projects, or teams under any circumstances.


Feedback

You can directly drop a message to author for plugin suggestion and feedback.
plugins.tagline: Create all Instance Combinations from Component Variants & Booleans

plugins.name: PointBreak
plugins.description:
With PointBreak, users can add multiple breakpoints, customize their values, and generate a horizontal ruler with markers for each breakpoint. The ruler can be positioned and resized as needed, making it easy to align elements and maintain consistency across different screen sizes.


To use PointBreak, simply input your desired breakpoint values, and the plugin will generate a customizable ruler with markers indicating the breakpoints. You can add or remove breakpoints as needed, and the ruler will update automatically.


Please note that PointBreak currently only supports horizontal rulers and pixel values for breakpoints.
plugins.tagline: Design for Responsiveness: Custom Breakpoint Rulers
